item.title: C++ Modify In-Place Operators in R
item.description: I recently started the Rcpp chapter in Hadley Wickham’s Advanced R. C++ has some similarities with R (sprintf() and if else syntax both come to mind) - afterall R is written in both native R and C, and C++ extends C with “classes”. Of course, there are many differences between C++ and R, such as scope, class, member functions, type declaration, etc. However, C++ has one thing that R currently does not have and is something that I believe can be implemented in R: the modify in-place operators:
